result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovon Levann Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jovon Levann Williams in court.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Jovon Levann Williams. Attorney Amy E Spanczak appeared in court on behalf of  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Return of Property hearing with Defendant's other case 22CF873. Discussion placed on the record. For reasons stated on the record, Defense moves to WITHDRAW petition for return of property. State did not object. No further issues needed to be addressed at this time. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial before Br 16.

Final pre-trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated September 29, 2022; received and filed.
State's Joinder Motion.  Received and Filed. nk

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams appeared by video.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Jovon Levann Williams.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Further, defense requests Final Pretrial, Jury Trial, and Return of Property hearing dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 01/10/2022. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial, jury trial, and return of property dates before Br 16.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Return of property hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Petition for the Return of Property
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.8.2022

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams appeared by video.  Attorney Michael F Torphy appeared by video for Jovon Levann Williams.  Attorney Annie Louk for Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense received most of discovery and requested more time for review.  Court granted defense's request.  Defense to file petition of return of property; requested return of phones.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Matter will be held via Zoom.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.22.2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 7.6.2022

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams in court with Attorney Michael F Torphy.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.22.2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Jovon Levann Williams in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jovon Levann Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
